results.content:
I didn't know anything about SEO before this. I haven't implemented any of these techniques into my website/blog yet - but when I do, it's going to be a breeze. I didn't know it would be this easy!
The only thing I'd actually like to know passed this is how to create dynamic SEO friendly url's without the use of a gem to do the work.

results.content: Decent basic info but clearly not an SEO expert or even Rails expert. Does not go into enough detail about topics and does not show intermediate - advanced SEO tips for Rails devs

results.content:
I didn't really know what to expect going into this course, but I was pleasantly surprised. All the content is very useful, and the instructor(David Fonvielle) delivers it flawlessly. He's to the point, and explains everything clearly. 

David always responded to my questions very quickly and he clearly took the time to give the best possible feedback and/or solution. I would definitely take another course taught by David Fonvielle. Highly recommended.
results.content_html:

results.content: Awesome course.  This course is very specific and direct.  How to optimize your Rails app for SEO.  The instructor gives clear and easy to follow instructions on how to implement SEO strategies in dynamic rails environment.  I have gone and implemented every one of his techniques in my Rails sites.
results.content_html: Awesome course. This course is very specific and direct. How to optimize your Rails app for SEO. The instructor gives clear and easy to follow instructions on how to implement SEO strategies in dynamic rails environment. I have gone and implemented every one of his techniques in my Rails sites.

results.content: Sat through the whole course in one shot. Very practical for newbies like myself.

results.content: I think the way you declare your @meta_title, @meta_description, @no_index etc is a great way to explain things but in a real production app this would clog your controllers really badly. I would suggest putting these declarations directly in the views instead ..

results.content: it seems to be quite rare that a course "simply" devlivers what was announced. Instead of lenghty modules and promoting 5,6,7,8,9,... hours of "content" this training delivery what was promised, without hours of self-loving introductions, history about this and that or even worse: non-related contents. Thanks! Please add more, especially about making a more advanced blog (cms!?) that salso targets customers in different countries (i18n)
